reviews.review_msg: Lazy. Doesn't even spend time giving feedback.

This course is HARD! I really appreciated how she would explain stuff in office hours. Her emails were very short but she went and explained things from the text practically every office hour. This class is supposed to be for non bio students but there's definitely an expectation that you know some bio first. If you can, try to get her as a TA!
She's respond really fast. The exam was very hard but met with me to really help with the paper.
Midterm didn't go well, but vienna was nice enough to meet and go over the exam and on another day, explained the confusing parts of readings. Fast to respond.
interesting class but lots of readings. vienna is fast to respond to emails and rescheduled midterm BEFORE the school was closed due to snow. A+ for caring about safety of students!

Took the distance version. There are a lot of readings!!! Interesting content but you have to read a lot to prepare for exams. Vienna was pretty helpful and answered a lot of emails so you're not completely in the dark like most dist classes

Took this in spring. Even though the tutorials are not marked, ATTEND! Vienna gave a lot of exam advice and does a great job of explaining the material. Exams were marked really hard but the tutorials were fun.

By far the most knowledgeable and friendly TA I have had in my 5 years of undergrad. I've had her as my TA for both Crim 355 & 356, and I can tell you she makes every effort possible to help her students. Her numerous awards are a testament of just how fantastic she is at what she does. Vienna is a real gem, and SFU is extremely lucky to have her.
Distance education with Momoko was great, she replies quickly to emails and helped me out. As long as you read all of the required readings the tests and paper are easy.
Probably the most dedicated TA I have ever had at SFU! Thanks Momo!
She was amazing! I would definitely take her courses again. Best TA at SFU!

I would not recommend this course if you are taking as Distance Education, in class with another professor may be still better.  the course itself is not tough at all, but the marking is serious as an offence (Pun intended). My advise stay away.

Jodie was just an absolutely wonderful prof! I thoroughly enjoyed her class every week, her expectations for the paper and the exams were clear and she was more than happy to discuss things with you outside of class time as well. Really disappointed that I won't be able to take any more courses with her for my degree, she was a real gem!

Jodie's one of my favorite prof's! She's funny, sweet, and very approachable. Exams are difficult, and the average for them were pretty low (like 65%) as they're all short answer and the final is cumulative, but if you study for them its completely fair and manageable. I'd love to take more classes with her!

I liked Jodie and took 355 Forensics because I though it would be interesting, and it was! However this is the hardest class I have taken and I took it as an elective. The exams were huge, extremely long, cumulative and a LOT of work. Interesting topic but HARD exams that are worth 70% of your grade.

Jodie is one of my favourite profs at SFU. Although she's Gail's student, I feel that she is just as knowledgeable and is so approachable. She gives you a lot of advice for the midterm and the final so there are no surprises. She gives you lots of help for the term paper and encourages you to ask her questions. Would love to take classes with her

Jodie-Ann Warren is fantastic! Interesting and engaging speaker, her lectures are great. Great sense of humour and has exceptional knowledge in forensic science. Midterm and Final are marked fairly - you do need to study and read in her class! Will definitely take future classes with her.
Jodie is my TM for this class, and I absolutely Love her:) Not a crim major so I won't have a chance to take a class with her, but definitely recommend her.

Jodi is a  nice prof, however her lectures are quite pointless. She reads off the slides and does not have a very interesting voice. She provided a good review outline for the midterm, however her final completely blindsided us and did not cover the material she said it would cover.

Jodie is the best prof she is super sweet you can ask her anything and she will do her best to answer! Her mt and final are fair according to the material & she will prep you very well for it. Her lectures are very interesting and take notes and pay attention she will give you clues into what will be tested! I would def take another class with her!

Took this class via distance ed. The paper was very fun to write! Jodie was also very helpful in preparing us for both the midterm and final exams. The study guide served as a very good tool for prepping for the exam as well. The exams are not difficult if you make good use of the study guide.

Interesting Class. The paper was fun to write! Jodie was very helpful since she provided a review for both the midterm and the final exam to guide our studying. The study guide is VERY helpful to prep for the exam. The exam is very fair.

Took this by distance ed. Pretty simple, straightforward class. Prof and TM's way too lenient with students handing things in late. Exams are challenging, essay was fun (based on TV show). Weekly exercises were easy, but some were ridiculous. No, I'm not going to buy a candle and a chisel to do one question worth less than 1%.

Jodie is very sweet, helpful,& approachable.She makes class interesting by incorporating pictures to complement her lectures, showing videos, having a guest lecturer, & bringing items to class. Class consists of 1 midterm, 1 paper based on a CSI episode (pretty fun assignment), and 1 final.  Exams are all short answer, but she preps you well.
Nice and approachable. Slides are helpful for studying for MT/Finals.

Suzanna was a great prof. I know I rated her as a difficult prof but she was... a good one tho. For this course lectures had core case info that is not provided on the slides and are needed in tests. 4 Open-book quizzes but timed (Do MC last to have time). No final/midterm. 5 writing assignments marked hard by TA's. 10% Participation in tutorial.

very cool class with a solid prof. I try to avoid lectures at all costs, but her lectures are pretty interesting. tutorials also pretty cool. Exams are pretty tough, not my best grade in a class but it was still prob my fav class at sfu in my crim major.
SO MUCH WORK and the grading was all over the place! Very interesting subject but there were so many assignments and Suzanna gave very mixed instructions.

Overall Suzana was nice and cared to help you understand. However, the TAs were awful. Very inconsistent grading with no feedback at all. At the end of the semester, we have no idea where we stand, it takes them 2 months to finish grading each assignment. In the biweekly one-hour quizzes usually there was not even time to answer all questions.

Honestly was not impressed with this course. Suzanna was understanding and cared, but the grading in this class was horrible. The TAs graded on and off on EVERYONE's work, so we did not have a designated TA, and there was a lot of inconsistency with grading. NO HELPFUL FEEDBACK was provided after assignments were returned.

i think the prof is genuinely nice and cares, the main issue was the TAs graded so differently and quite harsh especially compared to the prof. the class is extremely heavy in readings, assignments but instead of exams its biweekly quizzes which were generally fair but sometimes challenging

I think Suzanna it pretty chill and the material was good; no midterm or final or paper; just 6 open-book quizzes, 6 paragraph questions, and making your own test questions. HOWEVER, the TA's were insufferable and the criteria were super vague. You barely get feedback and your grade depends on who marked your assignments. Overall an OK class

Suzanna is very passionate about her class, lectures were fast-paced (due to strike catchup) but clear. Lots of reading but it's possible to get away without doing any if you stay focused in lectures and take good notes.

Good prof. Lectures are interesting and all the topics this course covers are interesting. Weekly assignments so make sure you plan time well. If midterm and final exam were in person then this class would be much harder, but she made it online for us. LOTS and LOTS of reading though. Labs are fun too.

Suzanna's lectures were super entertaining, she tried her best after the strike to make sure students didn't struggle by allocating our marks. There is a lot of reading from the textbook, but the exam mostly covered lecture materials so you should be fine.

Our class was severely impacted by the strike but Suzanna helped us re-allocate our midterm marks by quizzes each week of November. Although there is a lot to do and you must stay on top of your work, this class was very manageable and super interesting. She is cute and funny and makes little jokes here and there. Lectures were recorded

Great teacher, interesting lectures. Labs are fun and marked for participation. Monthly assignments, a mid term and final and participation was the overall grades. Not an easy class but definitely interesting.

This course was extremely interesting however the strike made it quite difficult. The material was dense however still interesting but try your best to keep up with everything if you want to do well. Labs were interesting and mandatory.

Class was heavy with reading each week. About 50-80 pages per week.  Each lecture was jam packed with information, and as my class was effected by the strike, they became even more fast paced.  The information is very interesting, but the professor didn't have much compassion that our class was rushed due to the strike.

I took CRIM 355 online and was not the biggest fan. No lecture recordings/slides, just paragraphs under headings. Discussion posts were due every week but it was pretty easy to get full marks if you put a bit of effort in them. The final exam was a lot more cumulative than I was expecting though, and I wish that was clarified further beforehand.
Two words: GPA Killer
This class was brutal, and the exams were time crunch. There was no lecture recordings at all, but there was tons of readings. Overall, very unpleasant and would not recommend this prof.
Marks at their own whim, not a pleasant experience as a student.

Suzanna is great and super chill. This class was in person but she recorded and posted every lecture. She kinda just reads off her notes but the content is interesting and tutorials are fun. You get to choose when you want to do questions for marks throughout the semester so its chill but the final was worth 40% and cumulative but it was fair.

One of the best prof's i've had during my undergrad. She made lectures engaging and interesting. She was caring, funny and easily accessible for questions or extra help. Always made sure we had reviews before exams and knew what to expect material wise. She also brought her dog in a couple times which was definitely a reason to attend class!

Very accommodating professor I really enjoyed attending her online lectures this semester. I found the content interesting so her lectures flew by. Slides are very organized and she does a good job explaining everything. I hope to take more courses with her in the future. 10/10 would recommend

Suzanna's lectures were clear, and straight to the point. The textbook offered a good source of background knowledge but she mostly touched on everything in her lectures. Lots of weekly participation, but it encouraged me to stay on top of things and understand the content better. I would take another class with Suzanna in a heartbeat!
Overall, this was an interesting class. It requires a lot of reading, but the prof was accommodating and understanding.

My GPA took a huge hit with this course. I had gpa 3.4 and it dropped to 3.2 cause of this course. I only took this class because it count as an upper level credit, but with this prof this class was made way harder then it needed to be. It felt on par with the 320.

I took this as an online class, but I had previously had Suzanna as a TA. She is very clear with her expectations and is approachable. She was also very engaged even with an online course and communicated with students frequently.

Suzanna is seriously the best professor I've had at SFU. I would take it like 100 times over if i could because she's a very strong lecturer and understanding of student issues ex. snow days. She was extremely informative and it was straight forward, no fluffy stuff.

Suzanna is a good instructor, especially given that she is still fairly new to it. My only issue with her is that she crammed a LOT of material into a short amount of time in lectures and consequently talked incredibly fast. It was essentially take notes now, learn later. Tests were all short answer but fair, but they comprised 60% of the grade.

Suzanna is an awesome prof, probably my favourite class that I've taken at SFU. Exams are all written answer questions and the final is cumulative. Gave us oppertunities to get extra credit and the labs were really enjoyable

Worst prof ever. Exams were ridiculous, took off one mark for each question just because it wasn't word for word with her lecture. Lectures were useless. She got offended when students weren't paying attention during lectures. How do you pay attention to a 70-slide PP where she literally just read out the points on the slide? DO NOT TAKE.
Interesting class and material but difficult to do well in. Do not take this dis Ed bcuz exams are difficult. In order to do well u need to memorize every minor detail and not the main concepts.

AVOID HER ON DISTANCE ED THIS IS A WARNING. Her mt/final was extremely detailed. Basically if you are studying the online study guide thats 50% of the mt/final. There are random terms that are out of the blue & she doesn't focus on the general procedures in the different units of forensic. Basically memorize the non obvious rather than the obvious

midterms n finals are hard. do everything that the project/research outline ask for. n if the scenario/case u choose doesnt have all pt according to the essay outline  then pick another episode coz u can loose huge chucks of mark.

Well she did it again, tricked everyone that the final would only contain a 2 mark question specifically from the textbook, but actually half of the exam was from the textbook in which she told us we did not even have to read for the final exam. The midterm and paper are relatively easy, but the midterm you have to memorize pp slides word for word.

Midterm and paper are easy. The final is very difficult. Much of it came from the textbook unlike her midterm. Went from about an A- range to a B after the final. The final is not easy, but fair. People have many misconceptions about this class after taking Niki's midterm and paper.

She made the midterm and paper a cakewalk. So easy that when we asked if the final was the same, she said yes, and it wasn't. Included stuff from the textbook that we were implicitly told would not be included. Kind of screwed us in that respect. Regardless, easy B+ for sure. Definitely an A-/A if you put in a bit of effort. Bad lecturer for sure

Very easy course. I have her for crim300W so i hope she's as easy. I bombed the final exam and saw a B on my final grade. She must've scaled it less for me cause it became A- after! EASY EXAM. easy marker.
She is great! I wish all were like her. Took by Dist Ed. and was very helpful. Take Crim just to get her!
Interesting at points and an easy A, but not academically challenging.  I'm not sure she *really* knew what she was talking about beyond her particular area of research.
